title: Karma To Burn - Arch Stanton  320k  mp3       ak2014
description:
What we got.... West Virginian trio Karma To Burn have been plying their trade now for nearly twenty years, and whilst they might not have been given the credit afforded to the like of Clutch and Kyuss, they have been instrumental in crafting some of the finest stoner rock releases you could wish for. With Arch Stanton, there sixth album they have returned to a strictly instrumental release after briefly flirting with vocals on 2011Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s V which featured Year Long DisasterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Daniel Davies.

karma to burn - arch stanton

For those unaware of the band, stoner rock and instrumentals can often mean long Ã¢â‚¬â€œ winded free form jams, but there is nothing of the sort on here. Karma To Burn specialise in three or four minute masterpieces, simply without a vocalist. The format that has served them well in the past has delivered another winner. They have once again stuck to simply numbering their tracks, but as usual have mixed them up so they appear out of sequence, so try to stay with me here.

First up we have Ã¢â‚¬ËœFifty SevenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, followed by Ã¢â‚¬ËœFifty SixÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, which open up the album with a couple of raucous, melodic classics full of huge riffs. There is a slight change of direction next, as Ã¢â‚¬ËœFifty ThreeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ comes in, a sprawling, almost melancholic doom laden monster, before normal service is resumed roughly halfway through the track.



Some of these Instrumentals can be good. As normal you will decide........
